node.title: Three people killed in shooting at Georgia gun range
node.description: The owner of the Lock Stock & Barrel Shooting Range in rural Coweta County was killed, along with his wife and grandson.

node.title: Scheffler leads Masters, Tiger stays in the hunt
node.description: A battling Tiger Woods clawed his way out of early trouble to stay in the Masters hunt carding a second round two-over 74 where the wind gave him more problems than his leg.

node.title: Why the Masters' green jacket is the holy grail of golf
node.description: The first Masters champion awarded with a green jacket was Sam Snead in 1949.

node.title: More Americans prefer daylight saving time to standard time
node.description: There's little support for switching clocks back and forth.

node.title: In a first, commercial crew docks with space station
node.description: The first non-government, privately-funded crew docked at space station Saturday for NASA-sanctioned research.

node.title: Dwayne Haskins, quarterback for Pittsburgh Steelers, dies at age 24
node.description: Steelers head coach Mike Tomlin confirmed Dwayne Haskins' death in a statement Saturday, calling him a "great teammate" and "tremendous friend to so many."

node.title: 17-year-old Ukrainian girl remains in U.S. border custody
node.description: Thousands of Ukrainians have been traveling to Mexico to seek asylum along the U.S. southern border since Russia invaded Ukraine.

node.title: After deadly train station strike, Ukraine's leader wants tough response
node.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said a missile strike on the Kramatorsk train station in eastern Ukraine amounted to another war crime for an international tribunal to consider.

node.title: Saudi Arabia expands Hajj to 1m pilgrims
node.description: Participants from outside the kingdom will be allowed after two years of tight Covid-19 restrictions.

node.title: Covid-19 hits Waikato Bay of Plenty Magic netballers
node.description: Two anticipated round five ANZ Championship netball games featuring the Waikato Bay of Plenty Magic have been postponed.

node.title: Political blacklist a sign Russia playing the victim - expert
node.description: A global politics professor says Russia is trying to paint itself as the victim of unjustified sanctions, as it blacklists New Zealand politicians.

node.title: Vehicle rebates miscalculated due to flawed emissions data
node.description: The Transport Agency says it is dealing with almost 100 vehicles with flawed emissions data under the Clean Car Discount Scheme.

node.title: Protest camp springs up in Christchurch's Latimer Square
node.description: A protest camp has sprung up in Christchurch's Latimer Square, where signs and tents have been hammered into the grass.

node.title: Will Smith banned from attending Oscars for 10 years after slap
node.description: Hollywood's film academy has banned Will Smith from attending the Oscars for 10 years after the actor slapped presenter Chris Rock on stage at this year's Academy Awards ceremony.

node.title: Local Government Commission axes Gisborne's rural wards
node.description: Gisborne District Council will be without rural ward councillors at its next election following a Local Government Commission hearing, missing out on its preferred option.

node.title: Few dollars no substitute for good conditions and safe staffing levels - doctors
node.description: The senior doctors' union says health boards are lazily and cheaply trying to lift staff well-being, while they are working overtime, double shifts and critically understaffed.

node.title: Dozens feared dead as rockets hit train station in east Ukraine
node.description: The state rail company says more than 30 people have been killed and over 100 others wounded in a Russian rocket strike on Kramatorsk train station.

node.title: EU chief condemns Bucha cruelty, offers speedy start for Ukraine EU membership
node.description: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen says the civilian deaths in Bucha in Ukraine showed the "cruel face" of Russia's army and pledged to try to speed Ukraine's bid to become an EU member.

node.title: 'I wonder how they can be doing it': Low rates increases queried
node.description: Mayor Neil Brown is surprised the Ashburton District's rate rise is one of the highest in the country.

node.title: Late strikes sink Football Ferns
node.description: Australia scored two goals in added time to beat the Football Ferns 2-1 in their friendly in Townsville.

node.title: 9 people transported to hospital when car hits food truck in Austin, Texas
node.description: Austin EMS said there was a T-bone-type collision around 9 p.m. ET, with one vehicle then being pushed into pedestrians and food truck.

node.title: Cannabis farm gets $32m grant: 'New generation coming into agriculture'
node.description: The government has given a cash injection to the country's largest medicinal cannabis grower, saying it could become as successful as the wine industry.

node.title: Pakistan's Khan set to face no-confidence vote again
node.description: A court ruled his move to block an earlier vote was illegal, paving the way for his possible removal.

node.title: Doctors' union says few dollars no substitute for good conditions and safe staffing levels
node.description: The senior doctors' union says health boards are lazily and cheaply trying to lift staff well-being, while they are working overtime, double shifts and critically understaffed.

node.title: WorkSafe charges Ruapehu Alpine Lifts, VTNZ over Turoa bus crash
node.description: WorkSafe has charged the company the runs the Turoa ski field and Vehicle Testing New Zealand as a result of a bus crash that killed 11-year-old Aucklander Hannah Francis.

node.title: Data shows aged-care facilities a hotspot for Covid-19 exposure events
node.description: More than 1000 Covid-19 cases have been reported at rest homes recently.

node.title: Maryland's GOP Governor Larry Hogan vetoes bill to expand abortion access
node.description: Democrats in the General Assembly passed the bill with enough votes to override

node.title: Shoppers urged to buy ethically sourced Easter eggs
node.description: Those shopping for Easter eggs this weekend are encouraged to buy their chocolate from ethical producers.

node.title: Mountain bike trails put new spin on Whanganui farm
node.description: Country Life - Tom Oskam, who has built mountain bike trails in Australia and Canada, is creating tracks through the regenerating forest beside the Whanganui River. Audio

node.title: Netball: Mystics' assistant coach Rob Wright - total recall
node.description: Most elite coaches won't go anywhere without a notepad, but Northern Mystics' assistant coach Rob Wright doesn't need one.
